asset.name: Efgartigimod (VYVGART / VYVGART Hytrulo)
asset.stage: Approved (gMG, CIDP) / Phase 3 (Ocular MG, Myositis, ITP, Sjogren's) / Registrational (Seronegative gMG, Graves')
asset.one_liner: Efgartigimod is the first-in-class FcRn-blocking Fc fragment approved for gMG and CIDP, with $4.2B in 2025 net sales and 6 upcoming Phase 3 readouts across autoimmune indications.

biology.simple_explanation: FcRn is a receptor that rescues IgG antibodies from degradation, keeping their levels high in the blood. By blocking FcRn, efgartigimod accelerates breakdown of pathogenic IgG autoantibodies, reducing the autoimmune attack on the body's tissues.

why_good_target.clinical_validation: VYVGART approved in gMG (AChR+) and CIDP; ~19K patients treated globally; #1 prescribed biologic in MG driving 60% growth in overall MG biologics share

mechanism.how_it_works: Efgartigimod is an engineered Fc fragment that binds FcRn with high affinity, blocking its ability to recycle IgG antibodies, accelerating IgG degradation including pathogenic autoantibodies.
mechanism.differentiation: First-in-class Fc fragment; first and only FcRn blocker approved in MG; available as IV (VYVGART) and SC with hyaluronidase (VYVGART Hytrulo PFS); autoinjector estimated 2027

partnership._note: No co-development partner. Delivery technology partnerships only.

by_dose.engagement: IgG reduction curve shown (slide 21) — efgartigimod achieves cyclical ~60-70% IgG reduction from baseline oscillating over 140-day period; no numeric axis values provided

pharmacology.pk_summary: PK/PD curve on slide 21 shows efgartigimod has cyclical IgG reduction pattern (oscillating between ~-20% and ~-70% from baseline) compared with ARGX-213 which achieves sustained ~-75-80% reduction. No numeric PK values provided.

lead.name: Generalized Myasthenia Gravis (gMG)
lead.patient_population: AChR+ gMG (approved); AChR- gMG including MuSK+, LRP4+, triple seronegative (pending approval by end of 2026)
lead.current_penetration: 17K addressable at launch; growing to 60K total addressable in US by 2030
lead.rationale: Pathogenic IgG autoantibodies against AChR are central to disease; FcRn blockade directly reduces these autoantibodies

expansion.name: CIDP
expansion.rationale: IgG autoantibody-mediated; blockbuster status as of 3Q 2025; 12K addressable at launch, 42K total diagnosed

expansion.name: Ocular MG
expansion.rationale: First and only development in Ocular MG; adds ~7K patients to US addressable market

expansion.name: Seronegative gMG
expansion.rationale: Adds ~11K patients; limited current treatment options

expansion.name: Autoimmune Myositis (IIM)
expansion.rationale: Phase 2 showed significant improvement in muscle strength (TIS); US prevalence 70K; no targeted therapies approved

expansion.name: ITP
expansion.rationale: IgG autoantibodies against platelets; ADVANCE Phase 3 IV and Japan real world data support development

expansion.name: Sjogren's Disease
expansion.rationale: Phase 2 reductions in systemic disease activity; Anti-Ro/SSA and Anti-La/SSB hallmarks; US prevalence 330K, 100K moderate-to-severe; no targeted therapies approved

trials.name: ADAPT Oculus
trials.prior_evidence: ADAPT ocular domain data and real-world case reports

trials.name: ALKIVIA
trials.prior_evidence: ALKIVIA PoC: significant improvement in muscle strength (TIS) in Phase 2

trials.name: ADVANCE NEXT
trials.prior_evidence: ADVANCE Phase 3 IV and real world data from Japan

trials.name: UNITY
trials.prior_evidence: RHO and DAHLIAS PoC: reductions in systemic disease activity in Phase 2

differentiation_claims.claim: #1 prescribed biologic in MG, driving 60% growth in overall MG biologics share
differentiation_claims.caveat: Based on argenx market research as of 4Q 2025

differentiation_claims.claim: First and only development program in Ocular MG
70% of new MG patients coming directly from orals (earlier line adoption)

competitive_landscape._note: No specific competitor drugs named in this presentation

market_opportunity.patient_population: MG: 17K at launch -> 60K US TAM by 2030; CIDP: 12K at launch, 42K total diagnosed; Myositis: 70K US; Sjogren's: 330K US (100K moderate-to-severe); ~19K patients on VYVGART globally
market_opportunity.unmet_need: No targeted therapies approved for Myositis or Sjogren's; limited options in seronegative and ocular MG

catalysts.what_to_watch: MGII novel primary endpoint; first and only development in Ocular MG
catalysts.bull_scenario: Positive data adds ~7K patients to US addressable market
catalysts.bear_scenario: Novel endpoint may not capture clinically meaningful benefit

catalysts.what_to_watch: Broadest MG label (MuSK+, LRP4+, triple seronegative)
catalysts.bull_scenario: Adds ~11K seronegative patients to US addressable market
catalysts.bear_scenario: Regulatory delays or additional data requirements

catalysts.bull_scenario: Opens rheumatology market with no targeted therapies
catalysts.bear_scenario: Disease heterogeneity may lead to mixed results

catalysts.what_to_watch: Cumulative platelet count in difficult-to-treat patients
catalysts.bear_scenario: Difficult-to-treat population may limit effect size

catalysts.bull_scenario: Opens largest indication by patient population
catalysts.bear_scenario: Historically difficult endpoint in Sjogren's trials

key_risks: Novel/composite primary endpoints across multiple Phase 3 trials
ITP trial in difficult-to-treat patients may limit generalizability
Rheumatology commercial expansion requires new prescriber base
bull_case: Market-leading franchise with $4.2B revenue and 90% YoY growth
Label expansion to 60K US addressable MG patients by 2030
bear_case: Novel Phase 3 endpoints create binary risk across 4 readouts in 2026
Rheumatology expansion requires new commercial infrastructure

key_debates.question: Will the MGII novel primary endpoint succeed in Ocular MG?
key_debates.bull_view: ADAPT ocular domain data and real-world case reports support endpoint
